edu.montgomerycollege.cmsc204.ralexander

Interface SudokuBoardManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SudokuBoardManager

    public interface SudokuBoardManagerInterface
    An interface to manage a Sudoku game. Allows the user to start a new game, enter (set) a value for a row,column combination, retrieve (get) a value for a row,column combination, return a string representation of the sudoku board and display all valid values for an entry in the puzzle. When entering a value, this class will check the validity of a value at the specified row,column combination, based on the rules of Sudoku. The class that implements this interface will use a Data Structure of a two-dimensional array of integers to represent the sudoku game. In order for your public test and private test to be successful, you cannot change this interface!!!
    Author:
    Professor Myers

      Return string representation of the sudoku board in the following format: 0,0,2,0,8,0,0,0,1 (new line) 1,0,0,4,0,2,0,0,6 (new line) .

    • Method Detail

      • setValueAt

        void setValueAt(int r,
                int c,
                int v)
         throws InputOutOfRangeException,
                ValueNotValidException
        Set a value (v) at the row (r) and column (c). If the value is valid for this row and column, the value will be placed at that location. If the value is invalid for this row and column, the value will not be placed at that location.
        Parameters:
        r - row in the sudoku puzzle
        c - column in the sudoku puzzle
        v - value to place in the row,column
        Throws:
        InputOutOfRangeException - if the values for the row or column are invalid (> 9 or < 1)
        ValueNotValidException - if the value is invalid for this (row,column) entry in the puzzle

      • getValueAt

        int getValueAt(int r,
               int c)
        throws InputOutOfRangeException
        Get the value at the row (r) and column (c).
        Parameters:
        r - row in the sudoku puzzle
        c - column in the sudoku puzzle
        Returns:
        the value for this row,column in the puzzle, returns 0 if value was not previously set
        Throws:
        InputOutOfRangeException - if the values for the row or column are invalid (> 9 or < 1)

      • displayPossibleValues

        int[] displayPossibleValues(int r,
                            int c)
                     throws InputOutOfRangeException
        Determines all possible values for this (row, column) entry in the puzzle, based on the rules of Sudoku
        Parameters:
        r - row in the sudoku puzzle
        c - column in the sudoku puzzle
        Returns:
        an array of integers representing all possible values for this (row,column) entry in the puzzle in numeric order, i.e. 3 6 9
        Throws:
        InputOutOfRangeException - if the values for the row or column are invalid (> 9 or < 1)

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Return string representation of the sudoku board in the following format: 0,0,2,0,8,0,0,0,1 (new line) 1,0,0,4,0,2,0,0,6 (new line) . . .
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of the sudoku board

      • newGame

        void newGame(java.io.File gameFile)
        Parameters:
        gameFile - the File with the representation of a new sudoku game. File will contain representation of the sudoku board in the following format: 0,0,2,0,8,0,0,0,1 (new line) 1,0,0,4,0,2,0,0,6 (new line) . . . 9 rows separated with a new line. Each row contains 9 values separated by a comma. A 0 represents an empty value
